verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329> upon Shushan-eduth<WH7802>, Michtam<WH4387> of David<WH1732>, to teach<WH3925>; when he strove<WH5327> with Aram-naharaim<WH763><WH5104> and with Aram-zobah<WH760>, when Joab<WH3097> returned<WH7725>, and smote<WH5221> of Edom<WH123> in the valley<WH1516> of salt<WH4417> twelve<WH8147><WH6240> thousand<WH505>. O God<WH430>, thou hast cast us off<WH2186>, thou hast scattered<WH6555> us, thou hast been displeased<WH599>; O turn thyself to us again<WH7725>.
Thou hast made the earth<WH776> to tremble<WH7493>; thou hast broken<WH6480> it: heal<WH7495> the breaches<WH7667> thereof; for it shaketh<WH4131>.
Thou hast shewed<WH7200> thy people<WH5971> hard things<WH7186>: thou hast made us to drink<WH8248> the wine<WH3196> of astonishment<WH8653>.
Thou hast given<WH5414> a banner<WH5251> to them that fear<WH3373> thee, that it may be displayed<WH5127> because<WH6440> of the truth<WH7189>. Selah<WH5542>.
That thy beloved<WH3039> may be delivered<WH2502>; save<WH3467> with thy right hand<WH3225>, and hear<WH6030> me.
God<WH430> hath spoken<WH1696> in his holiness<WH6944>; I will rejoice<WH5937>, I will divide<WH2505> Shechem<WH7927>, and mete out<WH4058> the valley<WH6010> of Succoth<WH5523>.
Gilead<WH1568> is mine, and Manasseh<WH4519> is mine; Ephraim<WH669> also is the strength<WH4581> of mine head<WH7218>; Judah<WH3063> is my lawgiver<WH2710>;
Moab<WH4124> is my washpot<WH5518><WH7366>; over Edom<WH123> will I cast out<WH7993> my shoe<WH5275>: Philistia<WH6429>, triumph<WH7321> thou because of me.
Who will bring<WH2986> me into the strong<WH4692> city<WH5892>? who will lead<WH5148> me into Edom<WH123>?
Wilt not thou, O God<WH430>, which hadst cast us off<WH2186>? and thou, O God<WH430>, which didst not go out<WH3318> with our armies<WH6635>?
Give<WH3051> us help<WH5833> from trouble<WH6862>: for vain<WH7723> is the help<WH8668> of man<WH120>.
Through God<WH430> we shall do<WH6213> valiantly<WH2428>: for he it is that shall tread down<WH947> our enemies<WH6862>.
